titles.title: Relating to a question of the privileges of the House.

action.text: DEBATE - The Speaker declared that the resolution constituted a point of privilege and the House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 241 - 184 (Roll no. 36).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 3/2/1994--Introduced. Declares that: (1) the House of Representatives supports the decision of the Committee on Standards of Official Conduct to defer inquiry on matters relating to the former operation of the House Post Office; and (2) the Committee should continue to consult with the U.S. Attorney and to review that decision. Provides that when the Committee determines that the inquiry would no longer interfere with the criminal investigation, it shall proceed with such inquiry.
